alert.note: Alert for Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 2:23PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Carbon and northwestern Albany Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 222 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Shirley Basin, or 37 miles south of Casper, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shirley Basin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin
